timeline.message: feat: PipInspector now will search for files named requirements.txt if detect.pip.requirements.paths is not set

timeline.bodyText: Does the current file finder take into account search depth? I know some customers are going to have requirements files not at root level, for that we could just say use the property.
timeline.author: JakeMathews

replies.bodyText: Hmm it doesn't. That seems odd. I think it's reasonable to expect that we'd respect search depth for this, I'll add that.
replies.author: rottebds

replies.bodyText: I talked with Jordan about it. We think what you already have is good
replies.author: JakeMathews

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I think ideally we should respect search depth here but I'm not keen on adding another property.
replies.author: rottebds

timeline.bodyText: Any reason for not using requirementFiles.isEmpty()?
timeline.author: JakeMathews

replies.bodyText: Previous code checked if the requirementsFiles object was null, so I assumed it must be nullable.
replies.author: rottebds

replies.bodyText: I suppose at this point we're no longer nullable, so we could use the other method but meh-- I think isNotEmpty tells a better story than !object.isEmpty()
replies.author: rottebds
